title: Tweet this: Longhorns stun Sooners - San Antonio Express-News

Image 1 of 12 Charlie Strong is doused in water by his players at the end of an uplifting victory at the Cotton Bowl that improved UT’s record to 2-4 overall and 1-2 in the Big 12. “We needed this,” he said.
Photo: Roger Steinman / Associated Press Charlie Strong is doused in water by his players at the end of an... Image 2 of 12 Texas quarterback Jerrod Heard reaches for the end zone while being forced out of bounds by Oklahoma’s Hatari Byrd in the second half of the Longhorns’ victory.

Photo: Ronald Martinez, Staff / Getty Images DALLAS, TX - OCTOBER 10: Armanti Foreman #3 of the Texas Longhorns... Image 12 of 12 Tweet this: Longhorns stun Sooners 1 / 12 Back to Gallery DALLAS — The fitness center at the Omni Park West hotel is open 24 hours per day, and contains two treadmills. Saturday at 3:30 a.m., only one was occupied.
Plodding away on the rubber belt was a 55-year-old insomniac with the weight of a sagging football program on his shoulders and a million thoughts racing through his head. So Charlie Strong perspired in the workout room for a while, then wandered outside and finished his five-mile run alone on the dark streets around Texas’ team hotel.
“It’s hard to sleep, because you know yourself what you have, and it’s not coming together,” Strong said. “But you can’t quit.”
Twelve hours later at the Cotton Bowl, with a golden hat atop his head and a five-mile smile across his face, Strong saw his perseverance rewarded. As his players danced around him, celebrating a stunning 24-17 upset of No. 10 Oklahoma that finally gave him a breakthrough victory, Strong beamed like a man who finally proved he’d been running in the right direction for the past 20 months.
For more, visit ExpressNews.com.
